intro: Helosciadium gracillimum, commonly known as slender false parsley, is a delicate annual herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–40 centimeters, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided, with a parsley-like appearance, and it prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Helosciadium gracillimum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, making it a common sight in its native habitat.
